chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.
items.plainText: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

items.text: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
items.plainText: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

items.text: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
items.plainText: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

items.text: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
items.plainText: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.

items.text: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.
items.plainText: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

items.text: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
items.plainText: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

items.text: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?
items.plainText: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?

items.text: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?
items.plainText: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

items.text: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?
items.plainText: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?

items.text: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
items.plainText: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

items.text: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?
items.plainText: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?

items.text: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
items.plainText: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.

items.text: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
items.plainText: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.

items.text: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?
items.plainText: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

items.text: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
items.plainText: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

items.text: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.
items.plainText: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

items.text: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
items.plainText: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

items.text: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
items.plainText: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.

items.text: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
items.plainText: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.

items.text: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.
items.plainText: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

items.text: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.
items.plainText: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

items.text: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
items.plainText: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

items.text: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.
items.plainText: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.

items.text: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?
items.plainText: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

items.text: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
items.plainText: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?

items.text: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
items.plainText: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

items.text: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
items.plainText: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.

items.text: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
items.plainText: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
